*[[Nicolás Maduro]]
(Disputed) {{refn|group|=|"n"|Recognized as president by the [[2017 Constituent National Assembly|National Constituent Assembly]], the [[Supreme Tribunal of Justice (Venezuela)|Supreme Tribunal of Justice]], the [[National Electoral Council (Venezuela)|National Electoral Council]] and the [[National Bolivarian Armed Forces of Venezuela|National Bolivarian Armed Forces]].}} *[[Juan Guaidó]]
(Disputed) {{refn|group|=|"n"|Recognized as president by the [[National Assembly (Venezuela)|National Assembly]] and the [[Supreme Tribunal of Justice of Venezuela in exile|Supreme Tribunal in Exile]].}}

[[Constituent Assembly of Venezuela|Constituent Assembly]] (disputed)
footnote_a: {{note label|name|a|none}} The "Bolivarian Republic of Venezuela" has been the full official title since the adoption of the [[Constitution of Venezuela|Constitution of 1999]], when the state was renamed in honor of [[Simón Bolívar]].
footnote_b: {{note label|languages|b|none}} The Constitution also recognizes all [[Indigenous languages of the Americas|indigenous languages]] spoken in the country.
footnote_c: {{note label|groups|c|none}} Some important subgroups include those of [[Spanish Venezuelan|Spanish]], [[Italo-Venezuelans|Italian]], [[Indigenous peoples in Venezuela|Amerindian]], [[Afro-Venezuelan|African]], [[Portuguese Venezuelan|Portuguese]], [[Arab Venezuelan|Arab]] and [[German Venezuelan|German]] descent.
footnote_d: {{note label|area|d|none}} Area totals include only Venezuelan-administered territory.
footnote_e: {{note label|currency|e|none}} On 20 August 2018, a new bolivar was introduced, the ''Bolívar soberano'' (ISO 4217 code VES) worth 100,000 VEF.
